result.execSummary:
Michael R Jepson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Michael R Jepson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael R Jepson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael R Jepson in court, in custody with attorney Jessica M. Moeller.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Moeller heard - Def. will now waive; documents signed and distributed; Def. remanded
Extradition hearing on June 29, 2015 at 12:30 pm.

Defendant Michael R Jepson in court, in custody with attorney Jessica M. Moeller.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Family members are present; This is to be extradition hearing; Atty. Moeller notes that Def. does wish to fight extradition; State heard on status of Gov. Warrant - waiting for same yet and asking for the statutory add. 60 days; Atty. Moeller requests cash reduced or signature bond; Def.'s employer is also present (Blew Inn); State opposes same - no notice for same and the $1,000 cash was the amount requested by SPD at last hearing; Court does not modify the bond, denies request but will grant State's request for add. time; State requests new extradition date; hearing set; bond cont.; Def. remanded

Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Restrictions on travel: May not leave State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Michael R Jepson in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This is Initial/Rights hearing on extradition; Atty. Vollan heard - Def. was witness in another incident; Def. has been in custody since 3/26/15; Court reviews Def.'s specific rights as to extradition; Def. is contesting extradition and Atty. Vollan requests bond set; State heard on bond - opposes any bond and heard on same (absconded from bail in New Mexico), if so, conditions: not leave State of WI; Atty. Vollan response; Def. lives at 716 Lincoln Ave. #11, BD, WI; New Mexico is 10% State; Court sets $1,000 CASH BOND:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Restrictions on travel: May not leave State of Wisconsin. Extradition review set 4/30/15 at 12:30pm in Br. 4; State to obtain Gov. Warrant
